topic.title: How to control the image size in complex static content

body.p: It is common to have text and images mixed together in a :before or :after pseudo element. For example, for the notes you may have both artwork and text:
If you want to change the size of the image you have two options:

ol.li: Separate the image from the text and apply the width and height CSS properties only on the image, using the width and height properties. You could use multiple ":before" pseudo-elements for that, considering that the farthest content presented before the actual content of an element is the one matched by the :before with the highest number in the brackets:
